qas.question: When was the Macintosh branded as Mac?
Who designed, develped, and marketed the Mac computers?
What did Steve Jobs introduce on January 24, 1984?
What interface type did the original Macintosh include?
When did Apple begin phasing out Macintosh in favor of "Mac"?
When was the Microsoft branded as Mac?
Who designed, develped, and marketed the IBM computers?
What did Steve Jobs introduce on January 24, 1988?

plausible_answers.text: integral graphical user interface and mouse

qas.question: What interface type did the original Macintosh exclude?
When did Microsoft begin phasing out Macintosh in favor of "Mac"?

context: The Macintosh (/ˈmækᵻntɒʃ/ MAK-in-tosh; branded as Mac since <a0_0><b5_0>1997<b5_0/><a0_0/>) is a series of personal computers (PCs) designed, developed, and marketed by <a1_0><b6_0>Apple Inc.<b6_0/><a1_0/> Steve Jobs introduced the <a2_0><b7_0>original Macintosh computer<b7_0/><a2_0/> on January 24, 1984. This was the first mass-market personal computer featuring an <a3_0><b8_0>integral graphical user<a3_0/> interface and mouse<b8_0/>. This first model was later renamed to "Macintosh 128k" for uniqueness amongst a populous family of subsequently updated models which are also based on Apple's same proprietary architecture. <a4_0>Since <b9_0>1998<b9_0/><a4_0/>, Apple has largely phased out the Macintosh name in favor of "Mac", though the product family has been nicknamed "Mac" or "the Mac" since the development of the first model.
